bill.title: Relating To Collection Of Restitution For Crime Victims.
bill.description: Establishes standards and procedures for withholding income to pay restitution orders. Appropriates funds to the Department of the Attorney General for enhancing restitution collection. Effective 7/1/2035. (SD2)

history.action: Prefiled.
Introduced and Pass First Reading
Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 4
Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Thursday, 01-25-18 2:00PM in House conference room 325.

The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 7 Ayes: Representative(s) Nishimoto, San Buenaventura, Brower, C. Lee, Morikawa, Thielen; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Takayama; Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) McDermott.
Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 215-18) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to FIN.

Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with Representative(s) Takayama voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Har, McDermott, Souki, Tupola, Woodson excused (5).
Bill scheduled to be heard by FIN on Friday, 02-16-18 2:00PM in House conference room 308.

The committees on FIN recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 13 Ayes: Representative(s) Luke, Cullen, Cachola, Fukumoto, Gates, Holt, Keohokalole, Kobayashi, Lowen, Todd, Yamashita, Tupola, Ward; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) DeCoite, Nakamura.
Reported from FIN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 777-18), recommending passage on Third Reading.
Passed Third Reading with Representative(s) Takayama voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Yamane excused (1). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 13).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to JDC, WAM.
The committee(s) on JDC has scheduled a public hearing on 03-13-18 9:30AM in conference room 016.

The committee(s) on JDC recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in JDC were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Taniguchi, K. Rhoads, Gabbard, Kim, L. Thielen; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from JDC (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 3032) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referral to WAM.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
The committee(s) on WAM will hold a public decision making on 04-06-18 11:00AM in conference room 211.

The committee(s) on WAM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in WAM were as follows: 7 Aye(s): Senator(s) Dela Cruz, Keith-Agaran, English, Kidani, Riviere, Shimabukuro, Wakai; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 4 Excused: Senator(s) Galuteria, Harimoto, Inouye, K. Kahele.
Reported from WAM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 3694) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading, as amended (SD 2).
48 Hrs. Notice 04-10-18.
Report adopted; Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 2). Ayes, 24; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 1 (Senator(s) Harimoto). Transmitted to House.
Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 608) in amended form (SD 2).
House disagrees with Senate amendment (s).
Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 608).
House Conferees Appointed: San Buenaventura, Cullen Co-Chairs; Thielen.
Received notice of appointment of House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 609).
Senate Conferees Appointed: Taniguchi Chair; Keith-Agaran Co-Chair; L. Thielen.
Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 804).
